French missions

From Europa Universalis 4 Wiki
Jump to navigation Jump to search

This article has been verified for the current version (1.35) of the game.

Available only with the Domination DLC enabled.

This is a list of all missions for France[1].

For the missions which France has when Emperor, but not Domination is active, see French missions without domination.

Completing the mission "Face the Empire" triggers an event which gives the choice between "Charlemagne's Legacy" and the "Kill HRE" mission branches.

Completing the mission "Papal Lands of Avignon" while having 50 papal influence, an alliance with the Papal States and while they have at least 180 of this country, will unlock the "Crusader Kings" branch. Completing the mission in another way unlocks the "Italian wars" branch instead.

French missions
Clicking on a mission icon leads to the appropriate table row.

National missions[edit | edit source]

Unify France[edit | edit source]

Mission Completion requirements Effects Prerequisites
Liberate Normandy
The Duchy of Normandy is a de jure subject of the Kingdom of France. It should be returned to our rule.
France or its non-tributary subjects owns the following area:
  • Normandy
 France:
  • Gets the event “The Ducal Ring of Normandy”
  • Gains a permanent claim on the following areas:
    • Brittany
    • Eastern Burgundy
    • Western Burgundy
Loire Valley Châteaux
The dawn of the 15th century has seen many advancements in the field of architecture within our borders. We should put our knowledge to good use and develop the many beautiful views of our country.
France or its non-tributary subjects owns the following area:
  • Loire Valley

At least one of the following provinces has been developed at least 3 times:

  • Touraine (4389)
  • Blois (4776)
  • Orleanais (184)
  • Anjou (178)
 France gets the event “The Gardens of France”
Retake Gascony
Gascony is rightful French land, occupied by an illegitimate claimant to the crown. Every English foothold in France must be reclaimed.
Provinces Bordeaux (174) and Labourd (173) are either:
  • Owned by France or its non-tributary subjects
  • Controlled by France
If France is at war and provinces Bordeaux (174) and Labourd (173) are owned by France or its non-tributary subjects:
  • Provinces Bordeaux (174) and Labourd (173):
    • Gains “Unification Movement” for the rest of the game, giving:
      • −33% War score cost

Else:

  • France gains “Victory against the English” for 15 years, giving:
    • +10% Manpower recovery speed
    • −0.03 Monthly war exhaustion
  • Provinces Bordeaux (174) and Labourd (173):
    • Lose 10 devastation
Burgundian Succession
The upstart Dukes of Burgundy fancy themselves a great power in their own right, yet in truth they are a mere vassal. We should remind them of this fact.
At least one of:
  • France or its non-tributary subjects owns the following areas:
    • Picardy (except province Calais (87))
    • Western Burgundy
  • Burgundy:
    • Has at least 75 trust with us
    • At least one of:
      • Is our subject and:
        • Has at least +125 opinion of us
        • Has less than 10% Liberty desire
      • Is our ally and:
        • Has at least +180 opinion of us
If France completes this mission while Burgundy is our subject:
  • France gets the event “The Duchess of Burgundy Dies”

Else, if France or its non-tributary subjects owns the required provinces:

  • France gains “Reintegration of the Burgundian Lands” for 20 years, giving:
    • +1 Monthly administrative power
  • Ten random owned provinces[2] in Picardy, Lorraine, Western or Eastern Burgundy areas:
    • 40% chance of: Gain 1 base tax
    • 30% chance of: Gain 1 base production
    • 30% chance of: Gain 1 base manpower

Else, if France completes this mission while Burgundy is our ally:

  • Burgundy will be more likely to side with us once the "Burgundian Inheritance" Imperial Incident begins
Liberate Normandy
The Armorican Peninsula
The Duchy of Brittany is not recognizing their proper relationship with the French Crown. We should persuade them to return to the fold.
Every province in the Brittany area:
  • Is owned by France or its non-tributary subjects
  • Has less than 1 devastation

Province Armor (169):

  • Has been developed at least 4 times
France gets the event “The Catholicon” Loire Valley Châteaux

Liberate Normandy

The Crown of France
For far too long have we laid splintered, our lands under foreign command. France can never be safe lest the region we inhabit is united under our banner.
At least 50 provinces in France (region):
  • Are owned by France or its non-tributary subjects
France:
  • Gains +10 power projection
  • Gains 25 convertible[3] prestige
Retake Gascony

The Armorican Peninsula

Face the Empire
The Holy Roman Empire is the greatest barrier to French expansion, and a constant thorn in our side. The Empire must either be abolished, paving the way for our ambitions, or else brought under French control.
France or its non-tributary subjects owns the following area:
  • Eastern Burgundy

France:

  • At least one of:
    • Is the Holy Roman Emperor
    • The Holy Roman Empire does not exist
    • Has “Scornfully Insulted” or “Insulted” the Holy Roman Emperor
  • At least one of:
    • Is rivaled by the Holy Roman Emperor
    • Has at least 2 times the military strength of the Holy Roman Emperor
    • Has at least 80% Power projection
France gets the event “The [Emperor.Monarch.Dynasty.GetName] Ring” Burgundian Succession

The Crown of France

Charlemagne's Legacy branch[edit | edit source]

Mission Completion requirements Effects Prerequisites
Sway the Electorate
Emperorship is not a title easily achieved, especially by a non-member of the Holy Roman Empire. Greasing a few palms and whispering the right words will certainly assist us in our efforts, however.
France:
  • Has secured the vote of at least 4 Electors
  • At least one of:
    • Has Influence idea 5 “Diplomatic Influence”
    • Has Diplomatic idea 5 “Experienced Diplomats”
    • Gains at least 15 diplomatic power per month
  • If is not the Holy Roman Emperor:
    • Has an army size iat least as large as that of the Holy Roman Emperor
  • Else:
    • Has at least +50 Prestige
France:
  • Gains “Imperial French Seal” for 20 years, giving:
    • −50% Envoy travel time
    • +1 Diplomat
  • If the Holy Roman Empire exists, is not the Emperor, is not a subject nation and there is no ongoing Imperial Incident:
    • The Holy Roman Emperor gets the event “The Heirs of Charlemagne”
  • Else:
    • Ruler gains 1 Diplomatic skill. [4]
Face the Empire
Right by Blood
Just like Charlemagne before us, the right to the Imperial throne of the HRE is ours. Securing it would only serve to restore us in our rightful place.
France:
  • Is the Holy Roman Emperor
  • Has at least 50 Imperial Authority
  • Has at least 95 Legitimacy
France gets the event “Protectors of the Empire” Face the Empire
Means of Expansion
Protecting the Empire from external threats is no easy task. Luckily for us, we are armed with one of Europe's most capable armies that will assist us in liberating and protecting our home's domain.
  • France:
    • Is the Holy Roman Emperor
    • Owns province Paris (183) with:
      • Great project "Versailles" as magnificent
  • The imperial reform Absolute Reichsstabilität has been passed
  • Every provinces of the Holy Roman Empire is owned by either:
    • A country part the HRE
    • A country that is subject to a country part the HRE
The ruler:
  • Gains 2 Diplomatic skill. [4]

Every ally with at least +50 opinion of us:

  • Gains 25 Trust towards us and vice versa
  • Gains 25 Favors with us

The magnificent level of "Versailles" gains, as long as we remain the Holy Roman Emperor:

  • +1 Land leader fire
  • +20% Reinforce speed
Face the Empire
Regain Italian Territories
The territories lost by the Empire over the course of the loss of Imperial influence over the region must be returned under our jurisdiction.
At least 25 provinces in Italy (region):
  • Are part of the Holy Roman Empire
 France:
  • Gains 20 imperial authority
  • Hiring Mercenaries will refund their Army Professionalism cost
  • Gains “Rightful Emperor of Italy” as long as we remain the Holy Roman Emperor, giving:
    • +1 Diplomatic reputation
    • +35 000 Manpower against imperial enemies

Sway the Electorate
Right by Blood
Means of Expansion

Kill the HRE[edit | edit source]

Mission Completion requirements Effects Prerequisites
Push the Imperial Line
The borders of the so-called Holy Roman Empire in the East are, at best, a laughable affair. They are neither secure, defensible nor manned by soldiers that can measure up to ours. It will fall and crumble before the might of the French army.
France or its non-tributary subjects owns the following areas:
  • Alsace
  • Baden
  • Romandie
  • Switzerland
 France gains “Victory in Germany!” for 25 years, giving:
  • +1 Monthly military power
  • +5% Mercenary discipline

Every province in the Alsace, Baden, Romandie and Switzerland areas:

  • Gains “French Buffer Province” for 20 years, giving:
    • −0.1 Monthly devastation
    • +20% Local defensiveness
Face the Empire
Break the Emperor's Ring
[Emperor.Monarch.Dynasty.GetName] rulers have the audacity of attempting to envelop our domain with the branches of their inbred line. We must break the so-called '[Emperor.Monarch.Dynasty.GetName] Ring' lest we risk be enveloped in it.
At least 30 provinces in North or South Germany regions:
  • Are owned by France or non-tributary subjects
France gets the event “The French Alliance Prevails” Face the Empire
Dismantle the Empire
The ill-fated charade that parades the name of the Roman Empire is naught but a sad state of affairs and clear delusional thinking. Breaking it and annulling its purpose would only serve to further our prestige.
France:
  • Has dismantled the Holy Roman Empire
  • Owns or non-tributary subjects owns the following provinces:
    • Aachen (1878)
    • Köln (85)
    • Frankfurt (1876)
  • At least one of:
    • Has at least +90 Prestige
    • Gains at least 14 military power per month
  • The Holy Roman Empire does not exist

No nation with its capital in North or South Germany region:

  • Has a larger army than France
  • Has more total development than France
France:
  • Gains +50 power projection
  • Gains 150 military power
  • If DLC 'Rights of Man' is active:
    • Ruler gains, if possible, the personality trait (unrecognized string “iron crowned personality” for Template:Icon) Iron-Crowned ( −20% Core-creation cost / −0.05 Monthly war exhaustion)
  • Else:
    • Gains “The Iron-Crowned” until ruler's death, giving:
      • −15% Core-creation cost
      • +5% Administrative efficiency
      • −0.05 Monthly war exhaustion
Face the Empire
Declaratio Gallica
The German lands formally protected by the Emperor are nothing but a low-hanging fruit for our ambitious conquest plans. Conquering them and making them proper French territory will surely eradicate one more threat from our borders.
At least 50 provinces in North or South Germany regions:
  • Are owned by France or non-tributary subjects
  • Have the same culture as its owner
 France:
  • Grants access to the "Military Hegemony" mechanic
  • Gains “Cultural Hegemony” for the rest of the game, giving:
    • −5% All power costs
    • −5% Great project upgrade cost

Break the Emperor's Ring
Push the Imperial Line
Dismantle the Empire

Provence and the Pope[edit | edit source]

Mission Completion requirements Effects Prerequisites
The Provençal Question
The Dukes of Provence aspire to much, but achieve little. They would be better off as subjects to France.
At least one of:
  • Provence is our subject
  • Provence is our ally and:
    • Has at least +150 opinion of us
    • Has at least 90 trust with us
    • Has a royal marriage with us
    • Is not at war
  • France or non-tributary subjects owns the following provinces:
    • Anjou (178)
    • Forcalquier (2991)
    • Aix (201)
    • Toulon (4696)
 If Provence is our subject:
  • Heir gains 1 administrative skill
  • Heir gains 1 diplomatic skill
  • Heir gains 1 military skill
  • If has a stability of less than +3,
    • then it gains 1 stability,
    • else it gains 50 administrative power.

Else, if Provence is our ally:

  • Provence gets the event “House of [Root.Monarch.Dynasty.GetName]”

Else:

  • Gains 20 prestige
  • Gains “Conquered the Capetian House of Anjou” for 15 years, giving:
    • −15% Aggressive expansion impact
A House United
The royal relatives in the throne of Provence have always enjoyed great autonomy from our capital seat of power. Despite their size, they wield considerable influence, and we must therefore strive to secure them under our influence.
France:
  • Has at least 95 Legitimacy
  • Has +3 Stability

Provence either:

  • Does not exist
  • Is our subject with at least 75 total development
France:
  • Gains “Strong Familial Ties” for 20 years, giving:
    • +50% Vassal force limit contribution
    • −10% Liberty desire in subjects
  • If completes the mission while Provence is our subject with at least +190 opinion of us and 100 trust:
    • Gains “Close Familiar Ties” for 20 years, giving:
      • +1 Diplomatic reputation
      • +1 Diplomat
The Provençal Question
Papal Lands of Avignon
Avignon has always been a thorn in our southeastern border. Despite our best efforts, it has always eluded our jurisdiction, instead pertaining its allegiance to the Papal States. We must decide on our approach in this delicate matter, assuming the Holy Father holds authority over Christendom.
At least one of:
  • Defy the Pope:
    • Province Avignon (202) is owned by France or its non-tributary subjects
    • France has “Scornfully Insulted” or “Insulted” The Papal State
  • Align with the Pope:
    • The Papal State is our ally with at least +180 opinion os us
    • France has invested at least 50 Papal influence in the election of the next papal controller
If France completes the mission by defying the Pope:
  • Gains access to the "Italian wars branch" missions
  • Gains “Italian Wars Expanded” for 20 years, giving:
    • +15% Siege ability
  • Gains a permanent claim on the following areas:
    • Piedmont
    • Liguria
    • Lombardy
  • If Naples exists:
    • Gains 'Subjugation' casus belli against Naples for 15 years
  • Else:
    • Gains a permanent claim on the following areas:
      • Campania
      • Calabria
      • Apulia

Else, if France completes the mission by allying with the Pope:

  • Gains access to the "Crusader Kings branch" missions
  • Gains 25 random monarch points and 10 Papal Influence every time a new Papal Bull
  • Gains “Resurgence of Crusader Fervor” for 25 years, giving:
    • +20% Manpower in true faith provinces
  • Gains a permanent claim on the following area:
    • Palestine
 The Provençal Question

Crusader Kings branch[edit | edit source]

Mission Completion requirements Effects Prerequisites
Protector of Catholicism
Catholicism has always been at war with hostile neighbors seeking to eradicate it. To protect our people, shield them from malicious outsiders and defend our legacy, God willing we shall protect it to the last man!
France:
  • Is Catholic
  • Is Defender of the Faith
  • At least one of:
    • Has a larger army than any Catholic nation
    • Is the papal controller
France:
  • Gains “Catholic Head of State” until ruler's death, giving:
    • −33% Curia powers cost
    • +1 Monthly administrative power
  • Gains 'Holy War' casus belli against every Muslim great power or country with at least 300 total development for 10 years
Papal Lands of Avignon
Crusade for Jerusalem
The road to Jerusalem lays full of enemies and foreign conquerors. It falls upon our shoulders to rescue and deliver her back to the warm embrace of our religion. Deus vult!
Every province in the Palestine area:
  • Is owned by France or its non-tributary subjects
  • Is Catholic

Province Jerusalem (379):

  • Has great project "Holy City of Jerusalem" as magnificent
  • Has a Temple or a Cathedral
France:
  • Gets the event “The Holy Lands of Jerusalem”
  • If completes the mission as Defenders of the Faith, gains scaling modifier “Soldiers of Christianity” :
    • Tier 1: for 25 years, giving:
      • +10% Manpower recovery speed
      • +0.5 Yearly prestige
    • Tier 2: for 25 years, giving:
      • +10% Manpower recovery speed
      • +1 Yearly prestige
    • Tier 3: for 25 years, giving:
      • +15% Manpower recovery speed
      • +1 Yearly prestige
    • Tier 4: for the rest of the game, giving:
      • +15% Manpower recovery speed
      • +1 Yearly prestige
    • Tier 5: for the rest of the game, giving:
      • +15% Manpower recovery speed
      • +1 Yearly prestige
      • −0.5% Yearly army tradition decay
Papal Lands of Avignon
Shield of Outremer
Our influence in the Levant has grown to unprecedented levels. For the first time in centuries we are able to proclaim the restoration of Outremer, the shining star of our faith in the Levant.
Every province in the Palestine, Transjordan, Aleppo and Syria areas:
  • Is owned by France or its non-tributary subjects
  • Is Catholic

If Jerusalem is our subject:

  • Jerusalem:
    • Has at least +190 opinion of us
    • Has increased its Total development by at least 200
France:
  • Gains “Fervent Call to Arms” for 20 years, giving:
    • +20% Manpower in true faith provinces
    • +1 Yearly army tradition
  • If completes this mission while having an Iberian subject or ally with at least +190 opinion and 100 trust:
    • Gains access to the Christian Holy Orders mechanic

If Jerusalem is our subject:

  • Jerusalem is renamed “Outremer”
Protector of Catholicism

Crusade for Jerusalem

Italian wars branch[edit | edit source]

Mission Completion requirements Effects Prerequisites
Crown of Naples
The southern Italian kingdom of Naples and its territories constitute a great control point of the trade flowing through the Mediterranean. We must secure those territories for ourselves and benefit from that trade.
Province Napoli (121):
  • Is owned by France or its non-tributary subjects
  • Has at least 5 buildings
  • Has great project "Royal Palace of Caserta" as at least noteworthy
  • Has at least 35 Development
  • Has a center of trade of at least level 2
France:
  • Gains “Kingdom of the Sea” for 20 years, giving:
    • +10% Trade efficiency
  • If great project "Royal Palace of Caserta" is not magnificent:
    • Add 1 tier to the great project "Royal Palace of Caserta"
  • Else:
    • Gains 100 diplomatic power
Papal Lands of Avignon
Ambrosian Succession
To ensure our position in Northern Italy is protected, we must expand our holdings to include Milan.
At least one of:
  • Milan is a subject of France
  • France or its non-tributary subjects owns the Lombardy area
France gets the event “Securing the Milanese Lands” Papal Lands of Avignon
City of Lights
Rome has always been the heart of one of the world's most populated religions. As such, we must bring it under our banner and enjoy the effects of basking in the glory, as the conquerors of Rome!
France or its non-tributary subjects owns the following area:
  • Lazio-Umbria
 If France is not Catholic:
  • Gains “Host of the City of Lights” for the rest of the game, giving:
    • −1% Prestige decay
  • Ruler gains, if possible, the personality trait (unrecognized string “legendary conqueror personality” for Template:Icon) Legendary Conqueror ( +10% Shock damage / −5 Years of separatism)

Else, if France is Catholic:

  • Hidden: Gains “Conquest of Rome” for the rest of the game, giving:
    • +10 Yearly papal influence
  • Holding Rome is legitimized and thus won't incur any diplomatic or papal maluses
  • Ruler gains, if possible, the personality trait (unrecognized string “fu papal puppetmaster personality” for Template:Icon) Papal Puppeteer ( +1 Yearly prestige / −2 Local unrest in catholic provinces)
Crown of Naples

Ambrosian Succession

Control the Western Mediterranean sea[edit | edit source]

Mission Completion requirements Effects Prerequisites
Arsenal des Galères
If we are to supplement our expansionist tendencies around the Mediterranean and beyond, we must secure proper naval infrastructure and a steady flow of able-bodied men.
France:
  • Has at least 12 galleys
  • Has at least 80% of its maximum sailors reserves

Provinces Aix (201) and Toulon (4696):

  • Are owned by France or its non-tributary subjects
  • Have a Dock or a Drydock
  • Have a Shipyard or a Grand Shipyard
If Provence is our subject:
  • Provinces Aix (201) and Toulon (4696):
    • Gain 1 base production
  • If has not completed the mission “Toulon Dockyards”:
    • Completes the mission “Toulon Dockyards”

France:

  • Gets the event “The Rade of the Toulon Arsenal”
  • Gains “Arsenal des Galères” for 20 years, giving:
    • +10% Galley combat ability
    • +20% Sailor recovery speed
  • Gains a permanent claim on the following areas:
    • Eastern Sicily
    • Western Sicily
Throne of Naples
The Neapolitan succession is a complex and contentious matter. Naples itself aspires to independence, but both France and the Iberian princes also stake a claim to it. This matter must be put to rest.
At least one of:
  • Naples is our subject
  • France or its non-tributary subjects owns the following areas:
    • Calabria
    • Apulia
    • Campania
 France gets the event “The Fate of Naples”
Crossroads of Continents
Sicily lies in the midst of the Mediterranean Sea, a body of water most vital for trade as well as warfare. Securing it will only further our influence in the surrounding region.
France or its non-tributary subjects owns the following areas:
  • Eastern Sicily
  • Western Sicily

Province Palermo (125):

  • Has been developed at least 5 times
  • Has a Shipyard or a Grand Shipyard
Province Palermo (125):
  • Upgrades Dock into Drydock
  • Upgrades Shipyard into Grand Shipyard

France:

  • Gains an admiral with 80 navy tradition
  • If The Knights exist:
    • Gains “French Raiding Parties” for 20 years, giving:
      • May raid coasts
  • Else:
    • Gets the event “The Knights of St. John of Jerusalem”
Arsenal des Galères

Throne of Naples

Kingdoms of Spain
Iberia is home to some of Europe's most illustrious and prestigious dynasties. Nations which wield tremendous political and military power, we must tread carefully and decide whether we shall treat them as friends or foes.
At least one of:
  • Has any ally who:
    • Has at least total 450 development
    • Has its primary culture in the 'Iberian' group
    • Has at least +180 opinion of us
    • Has at least 80 trust with us
  • All of:
    • France has increased its total development by at least 300
    • Any country with its capital in Iberia (region):
      • Is a great power or has at least total 250 development
      • Has been “Scornfully Insulted” or “Insulted” by us
      • Views us as an enemy
  • At least 15 provinces in Iberia (region) are owned by France or non-tributary subjects
If at least 15 provinces in Iberia (region) are owned by France or non-tributary subjects:
  • France gets the event “Victory in the Franco-Iberian War”

Else:

  • France and our designated Iberian ally:
    • Gains “Franco-Iberian Cooperation” as long as we maintain our alliance, giving:
      • −5% Technology cost
      • +15 Global settler increase
  • Our designated Iberian ally adds us as a historical friend

If France is the Catholic country with the most total development and has activated the "Crusader Kings branch" missions:

  • Gains “Light of Catholicism” for the rest of the game, giving:
    • +25% Papal influence from cardinals

Else, if France has activated the "Italian Wars branch" missions:

  • Gains 25 convertible[3] prestige.
Throne of Naples

Northern Italy missions[edit | edit source]

Mission Completion requirements Effects Prerequisites
Secure the Alpine Pass
The mountain line between our domain and Italy, the Alps, have securely defended Italy's inhabitants for centuries. If we are to conquer the Italian domains, we must cross this obstacle and secure the passes leading through the precipices.
If France has activated the "Crusader Kings branch" missions:
  • The Papal State, France or their non-tributary subjects owns the Piedmont area

Else:

  • France or its non-tributary subjects owns the Piedmont area
If France has activated the "Crusader Kings branch" missions:
  • France gets the event “The Papal Domain in Italy”

Else:

  • France:
    • Gains a permanent claim on Italy (region)
    • Gains “Entry in Italy” for 20 years, giving:
      • −10% Aggressive expansion impact
    • The Nobility estate, if exists, gains 20 loyalty
League of Cambrai
A mundane attempt orchestrated by some minor Italian powers is nowhere near powerful enough to halt our advance within Italy. We must crush all opposing forces and secure the region for the French crown!
If France has activated the "Crusader Kings branch" missions:
  • The Papal State, France or their non-tributary subjects owns the Venetia area

Else:

  • France or its non-tributary subjects owns the Venetia area

If province Venezia (112) is owned by France or its non-tributary subjects

  • Province Venezia (112):
    • Has a Shipyard or a Grand Shipyard
    • Has been developed at least 4 times
If France has activated the "Crusader Kings branch" missions:
  • Cede every owned province and core in the Venetia area to The Papal State
  • Gains “Venetian Craftsmanship” as long as Venezia is owned by The Papal State or one of their subjects, giving:
    • −10% Ship cost
    • +5% Ship durability

Else:

  • Gains 20 prestige
  • Province Venezia (112):
    • Destroy great project "Doge's Palace"
    • Gains “The King's Palace Residence” as long as "Doge's Palace" is insignificant, giving:
      • +15% Reform progress growth
      • +5% All estates' loyalty equilibrium
      • +1 Diplomatic relation
Secure the Alpine Pass
Secure North Italy
The house of Visconti and the ensuing civil strife within its domain only proves their monarch's inability to rein in the various troubled elements. We must alleviate their citizens of their ruler's incompetence.
If France has activated the "Crusader Kings branch" missions:
  • The Papal State, France or their non-tributary subjects owns the Lombardy area

Else:

  • France or its non-tributary subjects owns the Lombardy area
  • Province Milan (104) has been developed at least 5 times
If France has activated the "Crusader Kings branch" missions:
  • Cede every owned province and core in the Lombardy area to The Papal State
  • If DLC 'Leviathan' is active:
    • Add 1 tier to the great project "Duomo di Milano"
  • Else:
    • Province Milan (104) gains 3 base tax
    • Gains “Influx of Milanese Engineers” for 25 years, giving:
      • −10% Great project upgrade cost

    • Gains “Centralized Commerce” for 25 years, giving:
      • +25% Provincial trade power modifier
Movement of Centralization

Promote Trade Fairs

Embrace Colbertism
An economic and political school of thought, Colbertism can be considered similar to mercantilism centered around the main idea that the wealth and economy of France must always serve the state, further improving the monarch's grip to power.
France:
  • Has embraced the 'Global Trade' institution
  • Has at least 100 light ships
  • Has at least 50% Mercantilism
  • At least one of:
    • Has completed the 'Trade' Ideas
    • Controls at least 80% of the trade in our home trade node
If France completes the mission before the event "Colbert":
  • Gets the event "Colbert"
  • If has less than 90% Mercantilism
    • Gaisn 10% mercantilism
  • Else:
    • Gains 150 diplomatic power

Else, if France completes the mission after the event "Colbert":

  • If has chosen the option "An Excellent Minister"':
    • Gains “Expanded Colbert's Cabinet Reforms” for 25 years, giving:
      • +25% Reform progress growth
      • −10% Core-creation cost
  • If has chosen the option "Build a Navy and modernize the Infrastructure":
    • Gains “Centralized Colbert's Economic Reforms” for 25 years, giving:
      • −10% Development cost
      • +15% Production efficiency
  • If has chosen the option "Concentrate on Economic Domination":
    • Gains “New Colbert Trade Reforms” for 25 years, giving:
      • +10% Trade efficiency
      • +20% Provincial trade power modifier
      • +10% Global trade power
  • If has chosen the option "Concentrate on Naval Supremacy":
    • Gains “Colbert's Naval Approach” for 25 years, giving:
      • −25% Shipbuilding time
      • +10% Ship durability
      • +50% Flagship cannons
Fund Trade Ventures
Fires of Industry
Industrial complexes across our land produce tremendous amounts of goods. As we delve into the era of Industrialization, we must further make sure that our factories are properly funded as well as developed.
France:
  • Owns at least 50 provinces with any manufactory
  • At least one of:
    • Has embraced the 'Industrialization' institution
    • Owns at least 5 provinces with a Furnace
  • At least one of:
    • Is in a Golden age
    • Is an Economic Hegemon
    • Has at least 1 000 ducats in monthly income
France:
  • Gains “French Industrial Revolution” for the rest of the game, giving:
    • +0.2 Goods produced
    • −5% Development cost modifier
  • If has the trading in bonus for Copper and Iron:
    • Every owned province producing Copper, Iron or Gold:
      • Gains “Metal Barons” for the rest of the game, giving:
        • +25% Local goods produced modifier

Provinces Narbonne (2753), Toulouse (196), Armagnac (175) and Bordeaux (174), if owned by us with at least 40 Development:

  • Gain “Canal Royal en Languedoc” for the rest of the game, giving:
    • +100% Trade value modifier
    • +33% Local trade power modifier

Dawn of Absolutism
Reform the Legal System
Embrace Colbertism

Revolutionary missions[edit | edit source]

Becoming the revolution target unlocks the revolutionary missions.

Land domination[edit | edit source]

Mission Completion requirements Effects Prerequisites
La Grande Armée
Our army is glorious and serves the people! The banners we carry into war, in combination with our superior military maneuvers and discipline shall catch any enemy by surprise.
France:
  • Has an army of at least 90% of its force limit
  • Owns at least 50 artillery regiments
  • Has at least 75% of its Manpower reserves
  • Has at least 50 Revolutionary zeal
  • At least one of:
    • Has set Military National focus
    • Gains at least 12 military power per month
    • Have a 3-star admiral or general who is in command
France:
  • Gains 10 army tradition
  • Gains “Napoleonic Warfare” for 25 years, giving:
    • +10% Artillery combat ability
    • +15% Movement speed
The Peninsular War
The upstart monarchs of Iberia have taunted us for the last time. We must liberate the people under their chain and introduce their royal family to our guillotines.
Every province in Iberia (region):
  • Is owned by France or its non-tributary subjects
  • Has less than 5% Average autonomy above the minimum

France:

  • At least one of:
    • Accepts 'Castillian', 'Aragonese' and 'Portugese' cultures
    • Every province in Iberia (region) has our culture
    • Maintains at least 4 armies of at least 50 regiments in Iberia (region)
France gains “Iberian Domination” for the rest of the game, giving:
  • +10% Morale of armies

If Spain is our subject and has at least 500 total development

  • Spain:
    • Swaps color
    • Is renamed “Napoleonic Spain”
La Grande Armée
Cross the Rhine
To the East lie the Germanic territories of treacherous monarchs and oppressive overlords. We must swiftly alleviate their citizens of their royal bonds and integrate their lands into our domain.
France or its non-tributary subjects owns the following regions:
  • North Germany
  • South Germany
 France gains “Subjugation of the Germans” for the rest of the game, giving:
  • +10 Maximum revolutionary zeal
  • +5% Administrative efficiency
La Grande Armée
Invade Italy
The lands of Italy shall be our next campaign as we sweep across Europe. The seat of pretentious men of God and affluence will make a fine addition to our collection of provinces.
France or its non-tributary subjects owns the following region:
  • Italy

If has activated the "Crusader Kings branch" missions and The Papal State is our subject

  • The Papal State has at least 200 total development

Else:

  • At least 35 provinces in Italy (region):
    • Are owned by France or its non-tributary subjects
    • Have Barracks or Training Fields
France gains “Riches of Italy” for the rest of the game, giving:
  • +10% Goods produced modifier
  • −5% Development cost

If France has activated the "Crusader Kings branch" missions:

  • A random subject with at least 500 Development and its capital in Italy (region):
    • Swaps color
    • Is renamed “Napoleonic Italy”
La Grande Armée
Dominate Europe
Europe is nothing but a stage upon which we shall proclaim our domination as we prevail against the innumerable foes who seek to quell our movement.
France:
  • Is the highest Great power
  • Is an hegemon
  • Has a larger army than any country in Europe
  • Has at least 3 000 total development
France:
  • Gains “French Supremacy in Europe” for the rest of the game, giving:
    • −5% All power costs
  • If has had a golden age
    • Cancels any existing or previous Golden Age, allowing a new one

Cross the Rhine
The Peninsular War
Invade Italy

Modern institution[edit | edit source]

Mission Completion requirements Effects Prerequisites
Institute the Bank of France
The dawn of the Revolution saw our nation destabilized and destitute. To combat this we must enforce and nationalize a very important pillar to assist towards our economic recovery, our own national bank.
France:
  • At least one of:
    • Is an Economic Hegemon
    • Has completed the 'Economic' Ideas
    • Has at least 500 ducats in monthly income
  • Has less than 0.1% Inflation
  • Has less than 0.1 Corruption
  • Has no loan
  • Has national idea “Franc Germinal”
France gains “A Stable Currency” for the rest of the game, giving:
  • −0.5 Interest per annum
  • −25% Reduce inflation cost
  • −25% Administrative advisor cost

Ruler gains 1 Administrative skill. [8]

Reform the Guard
If we are to take on the injustices of Europe's most powerful houses, we will need the army to go with it. Thus, we should look into reforming our armed forces and improve their combat efficiency.
France:
  • Has at least 75 Revolutionary Guard regiments
  • Gains at least 14 military power per month
  • If DLC 'Emperor' is active:
    • Has any of the following country modifiers:
      • “Elite Revolutionary Guard Training”
      • “Mass Revolutionary Guard Training”
      • “Vanguard Revolutionary Guard Training”
      • “Professional Revolutionary Guard Training”
  • Else, if DLC 'Cradle of Civilization' is active:
    • Has at least 85% Army professionalism
  • Else:
    • Has at least 85 Army tradition
If DLC 'Emperor' is active:
  • If has country modifier “Elite Revolutionary Guard Training”
    • Gains “Drilled Elite Guard” for the rest of the game, giving:
      • +2.5% Discipline
      • Only applies to revolutionary guard regiments
  • If has country modifier “Mass Revolutionary Guard Training”
    • Gains “Guard Conscription Reform” for the rest of the game, giving:
      • −15% Regiment manpower usage
      • Only applies to revolutionary guard regiments
  • If has country modifier “Vanguard Revolutionary Guard Training”
    • Gains “Revolutionary Vanguard” for the rest of the game, giving:
      • −15% Morale damage received
      • Only applies to revolutionary guard regiments
  • If has country modifier “Professional Revolutionary Guard Training”
    • Gains “Professional Guard Reforms” for the rest of the game, giving:
      • +100% Army drill gain modifier
      • −15% Land attrition
      • Only applies to revolutionary guard regiments

Else, if DLC 'Cradle of Civilization' is active:

  • Gains “Trained Revolutionary Guard” for the rest of the game, giving:
    • +0.25% Yearly army professionalism
    • +5% Discipline

Else:

  • Gains “Trained Revolutionary Guard” for the rest of the game, giving:
    • +0.5 Yearly army tradition
    • +5% Discipline
Institute the Bank of France
Religious Settlement
The institutions of old may be archaic and of little use, however religion is a powerful tool in the hands of the ruler, and therefore we should investigate its potential uses. According to Napoleon himself, religion excels at preventing the common folk from deposing the rich.
  • At least one of:
    • The Clergy estate exists and has at least 60 loyalty
    • All of:
      • The Clergy estate does not exist
      • Has at least 4 Tolerance of Heretics
      • Has completed the 'Humanist' Ideas
If the Clergy estate exists
  • Gains “Church & State in Napoleonic France” for the rest of the game, giving:
    • +20% Clergy loyalty equilibrium
    • +1 Tolerance of the true faith
    • +0.5 Prestige per development from missionary

Else:

  • Gains “Popularization of Secular Beliefs” for the rest of the game, giving:
    • −1 National unrest
    • +5% Manpower in accepted culture provinces
    • +1 Possible advisor
Institute the Bank of France
Napoleonic Code
Our society cannot withstand internal and external litmus tests if we do not introduce a central civil code to rule over our society's norms.
France or its non-tributary subjects owns at least 50 provinces with a Town Hall

France:

  • Has at least +50 Prestige
  • At least one of:
    • Ruler's administrative skill is at least '6
    • Has at least 1 000 Government reform progress saved up
    • All of:
      • Has set Administrative National focus
      • Gains at least 15 administrative power per month
France gains “Civil Code of the French” for the rest of the game, giving:
  • −100% Expand administration cost
  • −25% Expand infrastructure cost modifier
  • +5 Maximum revolutionary zeal
Institute the Bank of France
Condorcet's Grandes Écoles
Knowledge can no longer be a noble man's privilege. By funding brave ideas when it comes to granting access to education, it is clear that educating our population is of utmost importance.
  • At least one of:
    • Ownst least 100 provinces with a University
    • Has at least 90 innovativeness
    • Has completed the 'Innovative' Ideas
    • All of:
      • Ruler has the personality trait 'Scholar'
      • Gains at least 14 administrative power per month
France gains “Funded the Reforms of Condorcet” for the rest of the game, giving:
  • −10% Technology cost
  • +1 Monthly administrative power
Institute the Bank of France

Naval domination[edit | edit source]

Mission Completion requirements Effects Prerequisites
Coastal Infrastructure
The dawn of the 18th century saw an increased shift towards maintaining a robust naval presence. To achieve that goal we must attend to our naval infrastructure needs.
France or its non-tributary subjects owns at least 40 provinces which:
  • Has a Dock or a Drydock
  • Has a Shipyard or a Grand Shipyard

France:

  • Has at least 500 development in costal owned provinces
France gains “Increased Naval Capacity” for 25 years, giving:
  • −15% Ship cost
  • −10% Shipbuilding time
  • +1 Yearly navy tradition

Every coastal owned province in the France (region) that fulfills the requirements:

  • Gains 1 base production
Dutch Revolts
The Low Countries have a history of revolutions and revolts against their masters. Therefore, we must assist them and bring them under our protective wing.
France or its non-tributary subjects owns the following region:
  • Low Countries

France:

  • Has at least 500 development in owned provinces in the Low Countries region
France:
  • Gains 1 navy tradition for every owned Impressment Office
  • Gains “Studying Dutch Naval Conduct” for 20 years, giving:
    • +1 Naval leader fire
    • +10% Ship cannons
    • +5% Ship durability
Coastal Infrastructure
Renewed Infrastructure
The era of coal and manufactured goods is dawning upon Europe and the world. If we are to keep up with the times we must make sure our infrastructure is of the highest quality, to assist with both our internal and external agenda.
France:
  • Has completed the mission “Connect the Provinces”
  • Owns at least 20 provinces which:
    • Has at least 25 development
    • Has less than 1 devastation
    • Has at least 3 buildings
    • Has enacted the state edict“French Infrastructure Network”
Every owned province that fulfills the requirements:
  • 29.4% chance of: Gains 1 base tax
  • 35.3% chance of: Gains 1 base production
  • 35.3% chance of: Gains 1 base manpower
Napoleonic Navy
Our foes possess tremendous naval might. If we are to protect our coasts and our people, we must match and outclass them with a powerful navy.
France:
  • Has at least 100 heavy ships
  • Has at least 3 admirals
  • Has a navy of at least 90% of its force limit
  • Has a flagship
France gains “Marine Impériale” for the rest of the game, giving:
  • +33% Movement speed on and off ships
  • +50% Blockade efficiency
  • +15% Global naval engagement
Renewed Infrastructure
Destroy the British
The British have been a thorn in our side for far too long. Their continental meddling and lack of respect towards our head of state threatens to throw a wrench in our plans, thus they must be eradicated.
France or its non-tributary subjects owns the following region:
  • Britain

France:

  • Has a navy at least 500 ships
  • At least one of:
    • Every owned provinces in Britain (region) has our culture
    • Is Naval Hegemon
    • Has completed the 'Naval' Ideas
    • Has completed the 'Maritime' Ideas
France gains “French Naval Dominance” for the rest of the game, giving:
  • +10% Heavy ship combat ability
  • +5% Ship durability
  • +10% Morale of navies
Dutch Revolts

Napoleonic Navy

Maritime Hegemony
The conquest of the Isles in conjunction with our naval domination shall pave the way for [Root.GetName] to be the undisputed masters of the sea!
France:
  • Has completed the 'Trade' Ideas
  • Has at least 200 light ships
  • The Channel trade node has at least 1 000 trade value
France gains “Trade Hegemony” for the rest of the game, giving:
  • +25% Ship trade power
  • +15% Trade efficiency
  • +10% Trade power abroad
